reviews.text: Will eat here again when I'm in the area.
Food was decent, but they got my pick-up order wrong despite my repeating yet again what I had ordered as I picked it up.
Authentic mediteranean cusine in Brooklyn,thank you guys!
Highly recommend this place for authentic Mediterranean cuisine.
Great food, friendly service, best Turkish coffee

the real stars here are the kebab and the gyro. The meat is perfectly seasoned, tender, and full of flavor, served with fresh pita and generous portions. Everything tastes authentic and freshly made, like real Mediterranean street food.

The gyro plate is my favorite - juicy, well-balanced, and super satisfying. If you're craving something hearty and delicious, this spot won't disappoint. Great prices too, especially for the quality
Best Mediterranean restaurant in Brooklyn. Fair prices, great atmosphere and extremely friendly service.

Have been coming to this neighborhood gem for a long time, even when it was under previous ownership. The food is delicious, the service is very friendly and welcoming, and there is usually plenty of comfortable seating. I've done dine in and take out - I would only say that their fresh baked pita is so delicious when it comes out of the oven that it's worth dining in to experience it.
La pizza est√° muy buena, el servicio al cliente es excelente, super recomendado.

We walked into this caf√© completely by chance ‚Äî and it turned out to be a real gem! Cozy atmosphere, attentive staff, and absolutely delicious food. The prices were a very pleasant surprise! From now on, whenever we‚Äôre in New York, we‚Äôll definitely come back here. Definitely 5 stars! ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
Nice food.
The food was well seasoned, very tasty and the service was good. The ginger-date tea was an unexpected delight. Even the water was tasty!
Nice  restaurant and clean bathroom
Great food
The lamb gyros is amazing. The portion sizes are also great. My friend recommends the chicken shwarma. I‚Äôd definitely come here again.
The place is very cute and cozy. Food was really good and with reasonable prices. Staff was very nice as well, I‚Äôll 100% come back üòä
Had the shrimp pizza, it was phenomenal!
We got a meet samples, and after trying I understood why this place has such high rating. The meat was perfectly freshlycooked (not just heated previously cooked).
Super leckeres Essen und freundliche Bedienung. W√ºrde jederzeit wieder dort essen. F√ºr mich ein super Tipp f√ºr bestes Essen in Brooklyn.
Best falafel in the North Heights. Pleasant seating area and some outside tables, weather permitting.
Fresh food, friendly people and fabulous homemade hot sauce.

Sehr sch√∂nes Restaurant.
Gute Atmosph√§re, sympathische Leute und leckeres Essen.

We really enjoyed this restaurant! Everything we had was great.. the spinach and cheese pie, the shawarma, lamb, pitza and so much more. The staff is very friendly and hospitable. We will definitely love to return.
Nice neighborhood spot - good food and friendly owner and staff
This was one of the worst and unpalatable chicken shawarma I have ever tasted. Dry, bad spices, no sauces. I don't recommend buying this.
Hate to be a bummer, but this place was sorta shockingly mid - so little seasoning or real flavor, small portions (especially for the price), just clearly not trying very hard
Our first time at Tut‚Äôs! We are from Florida and they were so gracious and nice! Come see ayoub!!
Wonderful food and staff. Service was slow paced and warm. We felt like we found a hidden gem üíé
One of my favorite places. I could get just the pita and I‚Äôd be happy- but also love the mix grill, all of the chicken dishes and the hummus.

Visited Tutt Heights Cafe after a long sight seeing day in NY and it was well worth it. Great food and good service. Quick 8-10 min walk from the Dumbo ferry point.
We ordered a platter where you can choose any of the 5 dips/ salads. They serve it with Pitas that are freshly made and are seriously fluffy and fresh.
They do serve spirits and we took a bottle of Wine for the table - worked well for us.
We ordered Shish kebabs - comes with dips and pita ‚Ä¶ and a veggie 10‚Äô Pitza which was a Mediterranean take on pizza - simple ingredients ‚Ä¶ and very tasty.
Good smiling servers with great energy.
Would go there again.

Five friends and I had a fantastic meal here.

We ordered three appetizers including tabouleh, hummus, and the cheese and spinach. All were delicious, but we particularly liked the tabouleh and hummus.

All the entrees were also well reviewed but it seemed like the lamb dishes were the stars of the show.

Highly recommend.
What a wonderful restaurant. Great service fresh food perfect Middle Eastern cuisine highly recommend.!!!!
We found this restaurant by chance and it was quite a discovery. We liked it so much that we repeated twice in the same trip. Highly recommend!!
Delicious meal, wonderful presentation, and nice staff as well. All around experience both times I‚Äôve eaten here.
I was treated really well here. It‚Äôs a charming restaurant. The food is really good. I‚Äôm not used to New York pricing so the food was $40 for their popular plate and a dessert.
Amazing service , amazing food , amazing customer service. 5/5 place ; highly recommend!

One of my favorite restaurants.
Chicken Adana and Falafel are amazing!
Delicious food, great service.

Food was excellent .Authentic Mediterranean cuisine with just the right amount of spice.
The service was excellent and the atmosphere was very pleasant.
I would come here again .
Amazing food and very nice service

Had a fantastic meal here! I ordered the lamb gyro and the chicken plate‚Äîboth were packed with flavor and perfectly cooked. The portions were generous, and everything tasted fresh. The lamb was tender, the chicken was juicy, and the sides complemented the meats really well. I also had the fresh lemonade, which was super refreshing and balanced just right‚Äînot too sweet, not too tart. Great service and a clean, welcoming atmosphere. Highly recommend if you're craving quality Mediterranean food!
Gutes Essen zum vergleichbar g√ºnstigem Preis. Waren nach der Brooklyn Tour hier eingekehrt. Sehr nette Bedienung und frisches Essen.

Een van de weinige restaurants die je, in Brooklyn of NYC op internet, kunt vinden die een simpele menukaart heeft met frisse, authentieke gerechten. Foto‚Äôs spreken voor zich zelf.. Absoluut aan te raden!!! 5+

Super restaurant, super accueil !

Les falafels et leur pain pita (qui sort tout chaud) sont incroyables

Ayoub, qui passe les commandes, est hyper gentil‚ù§Ô∏è
It was raining a lot. We stepped into this cozy cafe and ended up ordering a meal for everyone. We loved the Mediterranean hospitality and food. We plan to return.
Parfait !!

This restaurant is definitely one of my favorites! Not only is the food so flavorful and delicious the staff and service is also so wonderful. And when I say the food is delicious I mean literally everything! There is not one thing I wouldn‚Äôt recommend. They never disappoint. Even the atmosphere and seating is just so beautiful. The prices are also unbelievably affordable for such good food! This is a restaurant I would recommend to anyone even if they didn‚Äôt like Mediterranean food because they have something for everyone and nothing is neglected. Such an amazing place that‚Äôs worth many visits not just one.

Wonderful food and kind, friendly service!
Get the Turkish coffee after your meal.
Food was only okay. Probably won't go back. High price for value.
Our favorite middle eastern place in the area, and possibly the best restaurant too. Ignore the pretentious other restaurants around.
Great food and service. Highly recommend

An excellent Mediterranean restaurant.  Their in-house baked pitas are to die for. The Hummus and Babaganous were quite good as was the falafel. My favorite dish on our first visit was the lamb adana kabob.  They also have wonderful smoothies.

The service was great and the staff was very helpful. We will certainly return and would not hesitate to recommend Tutt Heights Cafe to anyone seeking a quality Mediterranean eatery.

Close but off the beaten path so nice place to grab some food and drinks. The server was lovely. The food was great and well priced. Sat outside, there are a few tables on the street and enjoyed the sunshine. The falafel  plata was delicious

This restaurant was amazing! The lentil soup was absolutely delicious, just like the authentic Turkish style we‚Äôre used to. We also ordered 5 cold mezes and they were also delicious. We had a really great time here. Thanks a lot!

We placed an order via Grubhub from Tutt Cafe and picked up at assigned time. The order process was not smooth because it got canceled and duplicated when we were picking up our order.

The staff was friendly but not familiar with the issues caused by Grubhub which was frustrating. It was fixed in the end by Grubhub but was time-consuming.

We had their Green Pitza, Leg of Lamb Plate and Baklava. The food was decent especially the leg of lamb. The lamb was cooked properly with no gamey taste even my husband who hates lamb finished his plate.

We were disappointed with their baklava which was not the best in our experience and the filling was way too little.

Great little hidden place. Staff was great and friendly. Prices very reasonable for New York.
Food was delicious!  Really also enjoyed the peanut butter and chocolate smoothie!

Run of the mill mediterranean restaurant plus pizza for the locals.

One person was  working the front section and a little overwhelmed. Nice enough guy, but it's too busy to keep up any service.

Try the Loomi, it's excellent!

Nothing stellar about the food or the presentation. The fresh pita was a nice addition, and the rice was good as well. The lamb was fresh enough, but a little overcooked and not seasoned as much as I'm used to when I'm in the Middle East. The flat wide skewer normally used for an Adana kebab was absent, so I got a round hotdog lamb stick. Fair enough, just different. The mixed salad had hardly any dressing, if any. At least it was fresh and diced small.

The mixed appetizer was a small portion and not worth the price to me. The onion chickpea side was a new one and not that appealing. I'm guessing that it is sumac on the pickled beats?

I'm being a little rough on this restaurant, but I expected better in NYC. Comparing it to every other Middle Eastern restaurant in the US only, I probably should give it 2.5 stars.

Would I return? No
Is it worth a stop? Meh...
Food was excellent . Nice hospitality.. lamabajin pizza was yummy must try dish.
Food and service were both amazing! The workers were kind and accommodating to our group, and the food was fresh and delicious. Highly recommend checking this restaurant out if you are in the area!

I enjoyed having the lamb kebab. The meat was a little dry and salty on it's own but eaten together with all the other parts of the meal tasted great. The pita bread is honestly the best part, they do it really well. Owner was really nice and accommodating to allergies.

A true gem, Tutt is a longtime favorite of our family. The green pitza is my absolute favorite - it it topped with cheese, fenugreek, scallions, and leeks - addictive! Their homemade pita is outstanding, as are all the meat (shawarma, merguez, wings), salads, and small plates (homemade hummus and labneh, to name a few).

They serve beer and wine, service is quick and friendly, and the inside is clean.
Delicious food for a very affordable price. We loved the lentil soup and the Mediterranean dishes. Great location and atmosphere. We will come back!

I ordered the chicken shawarma plate and everything was delicious. The chicken was well-seasoned, the pita was fresh baked, and the service was great! It‚Äôs a nice place to walk in for a quick lunch.
Good food off the beaten track, and in a nice quiet neighbourhood. Not too far from the main buzz at Brooklyn bridge and its immediate vicinity.
Food was very delicious, service was great. And I really like the atmosphere ü•∞ Thank you üôèüèª
La comida fue excelente, de entrada comimos falafel, y de plato principal kebab. Todo estuvo muy rico
DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND EAT HERE!! Literally amazing, delicious, complex, flavorful food! Staff was lovely and kind. Vibe was super chill. I cannot wait to go back!!!

Nous ne pouvons que recommander ce d√©licieux restaurant m√©diterran√©en, nich√© un peu dans les hauteurs de Brooklyn, tout pr√®s du quartier Dumbo. Le rapport qualit√© prix est excellent. L‚Äôaccueil est √©galement tr√®s chaleureux. Les plats vari√©s sont faits avec des produits frais.
Tasty food! Good portions and affordable prices. Pita was warm and very good. The meet has great spices. Recommend!
love this place! staff is super nice. great vegetarian options. the falafel is soo delicious, cooked perfectly and super fresh tasting.
This food right here hit all the spots. Also I bring the crowd to any spot. Forgot to take the starting plate. But you see the damage.  Spot by
Food was great. We had the garden salad and lamb and chicken kebab with rice. The pita is also very fluffy and freshly made. Tasty food and a good setting in a good neighborhood

My first time here I had good food and good service. A young girl was waiting tables, perhaps on a break from school.

But my most recent visit--this week--I sat and waited precious minutes while an adult male employee looked at his cell phone and ignored my table. The restaurant was not busy at the time. After the meal, the waiter continued his neglect, and I walked to the counter to ring up the bill, since no check was delivered.

It left a bad impression. I need a place that is consistently good, not as spotty as here.
